gubernatorial election 1962 held november 6 1962 democratic incumbent pat brown ran re-election vice president richard nixon concession speech nixon accused media favoring opponent brown stating press conference wont dick nixon kick more1 years later nixon elected president united states contents 1 election background 2 general election results 2.1 results county 3 references election backgroundedit edmund pat brown sr popular democratic governor california elected 1958.2 time california generally considered republican stronghold republican governors senators end world war ii election democrat clair engle senate 1958 browns election governor year state voted eisenhower 1952 1956 nixon carried state john kennedy 1960 presidential election 1962 popular incumbent senator thomas kuchel shoo-in re-election republican party felt gain governorship win state back democrats turned vice president richard nixon biggest time california republican party elected senator 1950 carrying state kennedy 1960 felt convincing win springboard nixon challenge kennedy 1964 narrowly lost 1960.3 conservative joe shell challenged nixon primary received support john birch society nixon beat shell primary 1,285,151 votes 65.4 percent shells 656,542 33.4 percent contest bitter nixon reach conservative shell supporters weakened general election4 bitter expensive campaign brown nixon campaigned great zeal effort nixon lead polls early brown chipped lead come election day nixon favored win close election brown won surprising 5 stunned frustrated nixon announced retiring politics general election resultsedit 1962 gubernatorial election california party candidate votes democratic pat brown incumbent 3,037,109 51.94 republican richard nixon 2,740,351 46.87 prohibition robert wyckoff 69,700 1.19 invalid blank votes 82,442 1.39 total votes 5,929,602 100.00 voter turnout 57.50 democratic hold results countyedit county brown votes nixon votes wyckoff votes plumas 66.44 3,397
